alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Harris; Marion; Meriwether; Muscogee; Talbot; Taylor (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 6:10AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Meriwether, northwestern Marion, Muscogee, northeastern Chattahoochee, Talbot, west central Taylor and Harris Counties through 645 AM EDT... At 610 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Flat Rock, or 7 miles northeast of Columbus, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Hamilton, Talbotton, Manchester, Pine Mountain, Waverly Hall, Warm Springs, Woodland, Junction City, Geneva, North Fort Benning, Bibb City, Upatoi, Ellerslie, Laurel Hills, F.d. Roosevelt State Park, Green Island Hills, Juniper, Vista Terrace and Cataula. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 AM EDT for west central Georgia.

area.areaDesc: Chattahoochee; Harris; Marion; Meriwether; Muscogee; Talbot; Taylor
